page.title: 12Recreation, Faceby (page i)
page.content: {Active sports.}The area is popular as a playground for Teesside, high ground at Carlton Bank being used for gliding, hang gliding, motor cycling and model-aeroplane flying. {Long-distance walks.}The Lyke Wake Walk, the Cleveland Way and the Coast-to-Coast Walk cross Live Moor, Bonny Cliffs and Carlton Bank, and are often used.{Ramblers and naturalists} also visit.{Horse riders,}individually and in convoy, use the roads and bridle paths extensively. The Bilsdale Hounds and Stokesley Beagles hunt over the area. An artificial pond has been created on Live Moor for{anglers}from Thornaby Fishing Club. {Holiday accommodation.}There are no facilities for bed and breakfast or board residence, but static caravans are used as holiday homes on small sites at two farms.
